meanings.definition: A loan with a higher interest rate than prime rate
meanings.sent1: The bank offered a subprime to the customer with a high interest rate.
meanings.sent2: Many people struggle to pay off their subprime loans due to the high interest rates.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that the subprime loan was so expensive, it felt like paying for a luxury vacation!
meanings.sent4: The subprime loan was a financial burden, weighing down on the borrower's shoulders like a heavy backpack.
meanings.sent5: The subprime loan was like a dark cloud looming over the borrower's finances.

meanings.definition: Below the standard or desired quality or value
meanings.sent1: The subprime product did not meet the quality expectations of the customers.
meanings.sent2: She was disappointed with the subprime service she received at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The subprime car was a real lemon, breaking down just days after purchase.
meanings.sent4: His subprime performance in the game was like watching a train wreck in slow motion.
meanings.sent5: The subprime condition of the house was evident from the peeling paint and creaky floors.
